member.name: _MFT_OUTPUT_DATA_BUFFER_FLAGS.MFT_OUTPUT_DATA_BUFFER_INCOMPLETE
member.summary: The MFT can still generate output from this stream without receiving any more input. Call again to process the next batch of input data.

member.name: _MFT_OUTPUT_DATA_BUFFER_FLAGS.MFT_OUTPUT_DATA_BUFFER_FORMAT_CHANGE
member.summary: The format has changed on this output stream, or there is a new preferred format for this stream. When this flag is set, the MFT clears the media type for the stream. The method returns MF_E_TRANSFORM_STREAM_CHANGE and generates no output for any stream. Further calls to or ProcessOutput will fail until the client sets a new media type.

summary.para: The MFT has removed this output stream. The output stream must have the MFT_OUTPUT_STREAM_REMOVABLE flag. (See .)

When the MFT removes an output stream, the MFT returns this status code on the next call to after the last output sample has been produced. When the MFT returns this status code, it does not modify any sample contained in the pSample member of the structure, nor does it allocate a new sample if pSample is NULL.
After this status code is returned, the stream identifier for this output stream is no longer valid. The client should no longer provide an structure for that stream when it calls .
The method does not return MF_E_TRANSFORM_STREAM_CHANGE when a stream ends, unless there is a change in another stream that requires this return code.

There is no sample ready for this stream. This flag might be set if the MFT has multiple output streams that produce data at different times. It sets this flag for each stream that is not ready to produce data. It does not modify the output sample contained in the pSample member of the structure, nor does it allocate a new sample is pSample is NULL.
If no streams are ready to produce output, the MFT does not set this flag. Instead, the method returns MF_E_TRANSFORM_NEED_MORE_INPUT.
